summary.value: A week of isolating at home, cancelled plans, a third mortgage application, an awful lot of TV, and some roller coaster building.

content.html:
• We got contact traced. We saw a friend after work and they got a positive test result the next day, which means we have to isolate for 10 days. We had a big shop delivered.

  • We had to cancel our holiday plans as a result. We were going to a house in the country with some friends, it really sucks that we canâ€™t go â€“ the timing is terrible. Also typical that we can go an entire pandemic without incident and then have to isolate the day before a trip. Oh well, weâ€™re still taking the time off as itâ€™s much needed.

  • On a positive note, cancelling our rental car paid for the 18 bottles of Champagne we ordered for the trip. Itâ€™ll last us a bit longer now too.

  • I donâ€™t have COVID. Charlotteâ€™s test results havenâ€™t arrived yet but hopefully sheâ€™s negative too.

  • My mortgage deck access appeal was unsuccessful, so moving onto application #3. It feels like maybe itâ€™s a good thing, because some new rates came onto the market and this new mortgage is considerably cheaper overall, so I think this is positive? Also, theyâ€™re fine with deck access so ðŸ¤ž

  • A lot of TV is happening in isolation.

  • Weâ€™re watching Too Hot to Handle, which is a nice level of trashy. I think Cam looks like Simon Legg and Cillian Murphy had a baby. I want to be in a beautiful villa in the sun please, but with nicer people.

    Don't you think?

  • We picked The West Wing back up (itâ€™s my first time, no spoilers please). Holy shit the final episodes of Season 4 though! Iâ€™m not used to this show making me feel so on-edge.

  • Iâ€™ve been enjoying Loki so much. Charlotte refuses to watch anything Marvel-related, I canâ€™t get enough of it and I recognise at this point Iâ€™m just going to keep throwing money at Disney until they stop making them or I die.

  • Charlotte and I started playing Planet Coaster together, we both liked Roller Coaster Tycoon as kids and this feels like a spiritual successor. Itâ€™s fun so far, but way more involved than Two Point Hospital.

  • I added a shortcut to switch between next/previous weeknotes (to be more IndieWeb). You can use the arrow buttons at the top of this post, or you can use the left/right arrow keys.
content.text:
We got contact traced. We saw a friend after work and they got a positive test result the next day, which means we have to isolate for 10 days. We had a big shop delivered.
We had to cancel our holiday plans as a result. We were going to a house in the country with some friends, it really sucks that we canâ€™t go â€“ the timing is terrible. Also typical that we can go an entire pandemic without incident and then have to isolate the day before a trip. Oh well, weâ€™re still taking the time off as itâ€™s much needed.
On a positive note, cancelling our rental car paid for the 18 bottles of Champagne we ordered for the trip. Itâ€™ll last us a bit longer now too.
I donâ€™t have COVID. Charlotteâ€™s test results havenâ€™t arrived yet but hopefully sheâ€™s negative too.
My mortgage deck access appeal was unsuccessful, so moving onto application #3. It feels like maybe itâ€™s a good thing, because some new rates came onto the market and this new mortgage is considerably cheaper overall, so I think this is positive? Also, theyâ€™re fine with deck access so ðŸ¤ž
A lot of TV is happening in isolation.

Weâ€™re watching Too Hot to Handle, which is a nice level of trashy. I think Cam looks like Simon Legg and Cillian Murphy had a baby. I want to be in a beautiful villa in the sun please, but with nicer people.
Don't you think?
We picked The West Wing back up (itâ€™s my first time, no spoilers please). Holy shit the final episodes of Season 4 though! Iâ€™m not used to this show making me feel so on-edge.
Iâ€™ve been enjoying Loki so much. Charlotte refuses to watch anything Marvel-related, I canâ€™t get enough of it and I recognise at this point Iâ€™m just going to keep throwing money at Disney until they stop making them or I die.
Charlotte and I started playing Planet Coaster together, we both liked Roller Coaster Tycoon as kids and this feels like a spiritual successor. Itâ€™s fun so far, but way more involved than Two Point Hospital.
I added a shortcut to switch between next/previous weeknotes (to be more IndieWeb). You can use the arrow buttons at the top of this post, or you can use the left/right arrow keys.
